text:
Bronchial anomaly of the right upper lobe.
 This case report presents a rare anomaly of right upper lobe bronchial anatomy.
 During routine right upper lobe resection for carcinoma, a common right upper and middle lobe bronchus was found.
 The resection was completed as a right upper and middle bilobectomy.
 Knowledge of this uncommon variant was beneficial in performing the pulmonary resection.
 A review of the literature is presented.
